intro: Sigillum verticillatum, commonly known as the whorled sigil, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive whorled arrangement of leaves around the stem. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens for its ornamental value.
